intro: Neoschischkinia nebulosa, commonly known as the clouded neoschischkinia, is a rare and elusive plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale green, arranged in clusters at the base of the leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires specialized conservation efforts. Its botanical study contributes to the understanding of alpine flora and plant adaptations to extreme environments.
